definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
to check/to examine/to inspect/to exercise restraint
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: All products have to go through three checks in the whole process.
sentences.chinese: 所有产品在整个生产过程中得通过三道质量检查关。

sentences.english: All products have to go through five checks in the whole process.
sentences.chinese: 所有产品在整个生产过程中得五道质量检查关。

sentences.english: All products have to go through five checks during the manufacturing process.
sentences.chinese: 所有的产品在整个生产过程中得通过五道质量检查关。

sentences.english: Both Kumho and Hankook have been the subject of regulatory scrutiny before.
sentences.chinese: 锦湖和韩泰一直都是常规质量检查对象。

sentences.english: As soon as the quality check have been over the initial payment will be sent.
sentences.chinese: 只要有质量检查在首期付款被将被发送。

sentences.english: All proudest have to go through five checks in the whole process.
sentences.chinese: 所有商品在整个生产过程中得通过五道质量检查关。

sentences.english: Products that have passed their quality checks and are approved are baselined products.
sentences.chinese: 经过质量检查并已被批准的产品将成为基线产品。

sentences.english: Make standard of quality inspection instruction.
sentences.chinese: 制定质量检查操作规范。

sentences.english: Our objects HAs be endorsed by the National Quality Inspection Association.
sentences.chinese: 咱们的产业商品为全国质量检查协会力荐产业商品。

sentences.english: They also allow for quality checks before actual RTD beverage filling starts.
sentences.chinese: 它们还能便于饮料充装进行时的质量检查。

sentences.english: All the prefabricated components have passed the state quality test.
sentences.chinese: 预制件已经全部通过国家的质量检查。

sentences.english: Our products have been endorsed by the National Quality Inspection Association.
sentences.chinese: 我们的产品为全国质量检查协会的推荐产品。

sentences.english: It was a major improvement on census post-quality survey.
sentences.chinese: 这是对人口普查事后质量检查工作的一项重大改进。

definition: random inspection/to do a spot check
to reconsider/to reexamine/to review (e.g. a report prior to accepting it)
to test a random sample/to spot-check
to report for judgment/to submit for approval
retention sample/(of a manufacturer, esp. of food or drugs) to retain a sample of a batch of a product (abbr. for 保留樣品|保留样品[bao3 liu2 yang4 pin3])
